nodeMetric.field_description: Emails Clicked is the number of unique recipients who clicked on any link in your email. Clicks, or Click Through Rate, is often the key measurable result for most email campaigns and a good indicator of the quality of content.

body.processed:
Once your email campaign has been successfully delivered, and a recipient has actually opened the email, your next objective is to have them click through on a call-to-action. Your audience will make a split second decision on whether your email is worth reading. Here are some best practices to consider:

1. Start with a simple and compelling subject line that sets the userâ€™s expectations. Keep in mind that over half of emails are read on mobile devices, so keep it short.
2. The more effort you put into the design, the visual clarity, and simplicity of your email, the better it will be received. Focus the reader on your call-to-action and eliminate distractions.
3. The first few words count. You only have a few seconds. A glance at the top of your email should be all it takes to hook your reader.
4. Create targeted email lists to ensure content is relevant for each user segment. Make sure the offers, subject line, and images are appropriate to your audience. This strengthens customer relationships and increases the chance of a call to action (CTA).
body.summary: Emails Clicked is the number of unique recipients who clicked on any link in your email.

field_related_metrics.field_description: Email Click Rate is the number of unique recipients who clicked on any link in your email, represented as a percentage of successfully delivered emails.

Click To Open Rate (CTOR) is the percentage of unique clicks and unique opens for your email campaign. It is an effective measure of how compelling your content is relative to the quality of your target list. In other words, ensuring you have emailed the right audience and have presented them with a compelling call to action will increase your CTOR.

Emails Opened is the number of unique recipients who opened your email. Because the number of people who open your email impacts every other downstream metric, such as clicks, it makes sense to pay special attention to this one.
